keyword: how many calories are in green apples
title: How Many Calories Are in Green Apples?
meta_description: Discover how many calories are in green apples, including macros like carbs, fiber, protein, and fat for one medium apple, plus tweaks and FAQs.
h1: How Many Calories Are in Green Apples?
assumptions: Medium size (~182 g), raw with skin, core included; Granny Smith variety or similar green apple.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by apple size, variety, ripeness, and growing conditions. Values are averages; check for organic or specific brands.

quick_answer.text: One medium green apple provides about 95 kcal, 4.4 g fiber, and 19 g natural sugars.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison with packaged produce.

faqs.q: How many calories are in one green apple?
faqs.a: About 95 kcal for a medium green apple (~182 g).

faqs.q: Are green apples lower in calories than red?
faqs.a: Similar—both around 95 kcal per medium apple; green may have slightly more fiber.

faqs.q: How much sugar is in green apples?
faqs.a: Approximately 19 g of natural sugars per medium apple.

faqs.q: Do green apples have fat or protein?
faqs.a: Very low: 0.3 g fat and 0.5 g protein per medium apple.

faqs.q: How does apple size affect calories?
faqs.a: Small (~129 g) ≈ 70 kcal; large (~223 g) ≈ 116 kcal. Adjust based on weight.
